abstract: The lawmaker implored senators not to set a precedent that would cede Congress’s investigative authority to the executive branch for generations to come.
lead_paragraph: In his closing remarks, Representative Adam Schiff of California, the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, outlined a dire warning: that a failure to reprove President Trump for obstructing Congress would inflict “an unending injury to this country” because “the balance of power that our founders set out will never be the same.”
